TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit AutoGeneratedFieldProperties extends System.Object implements class System.Web.UI.IStateManager

Docs.summary: Represents the properties of an object. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedFieldProperties> class is used by data-bound controls to specify the properties of an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedField> object when creating an automatically generated field. For example, when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control creates an automatically generated row, it creates an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedFieldProperties> object with the row's properties and passes it to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView.CreateAutoGeneratedRow%2A> method. Likewise, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control passes an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedFieldProperties> object to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView.CreateAutoGeneratedColumn%2A> method when creating an automatically generated column.
> [!NOTE] > This class is typically used only when extending the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control.
You can specify the name of the field to bind to an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedField> object by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedFieldProperties.DataField%2A> property. To specify the data type of the field values, set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedFieldProperties.Type%2A> property. You can prevent users from modifying the field values by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedFieldProperties.IsReadOnly%2A> property to `true`. You can also assign a name to an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedField> object by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedFieldProperties.Name%2A> property.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedFieldProperties> class to create an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedField> object in a custom control that derives from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control.
[!code-csharp[AutoGenerateFieldProperties#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/AutoGenerateFieldProperties/CS/SimpleCustomControl.cs#1)] [!code-vb[AutoGenerateFieldProperties#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/AutoGenerateFieldProperties/VB/SimpleCustomControl.vb#1)]

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this constructor to create a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedFieldProperties> class.
> [!NOTE] > This constructor is primarily used by control developers when extending a data-bound control.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the name of the field bound to the object.
Docs.value: The name of the field bound to the . The default is an empty string (""), which indicates that this property is not set.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedFieldProperties.DataField%2A> property to specify the name of the data field to bind to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedField> object. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedField> object automatically displays the values in the appropriate control, based on the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedFieldProperties.Type%2A> property. For example, <xref:System.Boolean> values are displayed in check box controls, while <xref:System.String> values are displayed as plain text.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedFieldProperties.DataField%2A> property to determine the value with which to set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BoundField.DataField%2A> property of an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedField> object.
[!code-csharp[AutoGenerateFieldProperties#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/AutoGenerateFieldProperties/CS/SimpleCustomControl.cs#1)] [!code-vb[AutoGenerateFieldProperties#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/AutoGenerateFieldProperties/VB/SimpleCustomControl.vb#1)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the values displayed in an object can be modified in edit mode.
Docs.value: to indicate that the values are read-only; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedFieldProperties.IsReadOnly%2A> property to specify whether the values of the field bound to an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedField> object can be modified in edit mode. When a data-bound control is in edit mode, fields that are read-only are displayed as plain text, without any editing controls.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedFieldProperties.IsReadOnly%2A> property to determine the value with which to set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BoundField.ReadOnly%2A> property of an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedField> object.
[!code-csharp[AutoGenerateFieldProperties#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/AutoGenerateFieldProperties/CS/SimpleCustomControl.cs#1)] [!code-vb[AutoGenerateFieldProperties#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/AutoGenerateFieldProperties/VB/SimpleCustomControl.vb#1)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the name of the object.
Docs.value: The name of the object. The default is an empty string (""), which indicates that this property is not set.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedFieldProperties.Name%2A> property to specify the name of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedField> object. The name is often the name of the field bound to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedField> object. The value of this property is also displayed in the header section of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedField> object in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> or a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedFieldProperties.Name%2A> property to determine the value with which to set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField.HeaderText%2A> property of an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedField> object.
[!code-csharp[AutoGenerateFieldProperties#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/AutoGenerateFieldProperties/CS/SimpleCustomControl.cs#1)] [!code-vb[AutoGenerateFieldProperties#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/AutoGenerateFieldProperties/VB/SimpleCustomControl.vb#1)]

Docs.value: to indicate that the object is tracking its view-state changes; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedFieldProperties.System%23Web%23UI%23IStateManager%23IsTrackingViewState%2A> property is used to determine whether the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedFieldProperties> object is tracking its view-state changes.
> [!NOTE] > This property is used primarily by control developers.

## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedFieldProperties.System%23Web%23UI%23IStateManager%23LoadViewState%2A> method is used to load the previously saved view state of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedFieldProperties> control.
> [!NOTE] > This method is used primarily by control developers when extending the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedFieldProperties> control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedFieldProperties.System%23Web%23UI%23IStateManager%23SaveViewState%2A> method is a helper method used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedFieldProperties> class to save the state of the object.

MemberSignature.Value: .method hidebysig newslot virtual instance void System.Web.UI.IStateManager.TrackViewState() cil managed

Docs.summary: Marks the starting point at which to begin tracking and saving view-state changes to the object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method is overridden to mark the starting point at which to begin tracking and saving changes to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedFieldProperties> object as part of the object's view state.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the data type of the value displayed in an object.
Docs.value: A that represents the data type of the value displayed in an object. The default is , which indicates that this property is not set.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedFieldProperties.Type%2A> property to specify the data type of the value displayed in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedField> object. The data type determines what type of control is rendered in an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedField> object to display the value. For example, a check box control is displayed when the type is <xref:System.Boolean>.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedFieldProperties.Type%2A> property to determine the value with which to set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedField.DataType%2A> property of an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedField> object.
